stanza.line: Who will believe my verse in time to comecome

Though yet heaven knows it is but as a tombtomb
Which hides your life and shows not half your partsparts
If I could write the beauty of your eyeseyes
And in fresh numbers number all your gracesgraces
The age to come would say this poet lieslies
Such heavenly touches neer touched earthly facesfaces
So should my papers (yellowed with their age)age)
Be scorned like old men of less truth than tonguetongue
And your true rights be termed a poet ragerage
And stretched metre of an antique songsong
But were some child of yours alive that timetime
